The Major Penitentiary has the appointment of acertain number of Minores Paenitentiam who sitin the three basilicas of St. Peter's, St. John Lateran and Santa Maria Maggiore, to hear the confessione of penitents from all lands and to grant absolutione, imposing on them fitting penance. They have faculties in regard to certain reserved cases, but they are merely confessors with somewhat enlarged powers and their functions are altogether different from that of the Congregation of the Penitentiary, of which they form no part. For details see the Manuale Facultatum minorum Poencfentiariornm Apostolicorum, Romae, 1879.

It is possible that the functionaries objurgated by John XXII. and imprisoned by Cardinal Annibaldo may have been of this class.
